programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Drowning Closet, Ostrich Eggs, Merry Go Round" - Water rises in a glass closet as contestants struggle to unlock the door and escape.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Scooter Plank, Deer Jewels/100 Year Old Egg Nog, Trapped Under The Ice" - Contestants must ride a motorized scooter across a narrow plank 100 feet above the ground and devour roasted reindeer parts. Host: Joe Rogan.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Helicopter Bodt Drop, Slug Bugs and Bile, Build-A-Bridge" - For the first stunt contestants have to hang from a helicopter skit and drop into the water below as the helicopter flew over a buoy. Once in the water, they would have to retrieve a flag from underneath the buoy, swim with it to a platform, and clip it on a flagpole. Stunt two has them slug it out as they have to eat 10 live slugs and drink a shot of cow bile. For the final, contestants have to build a bridge on two cables from the top of one building to another and climb across the wooden slats provided moving them along the way. The contestant across the fastest would be the Fear Factor Champion and win $50K.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Inverted Heli Hang, Horse Rectum, Sky Walker" - Contestants have to complete the following stunts: Inverted heli hang/Horse rectum/Sky walker.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Barrel Rolling, Rat Transfer, Car Jump into Pond" - Can the contestants master the barrel roll, the dead rat race and the suicidal drive in the fastest time?

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Spin Cycle, Breakfast of Champions, Stilt Walking" - Contestants must consume balut -- eggs containing partially developed duck embryos -- as well as liquefied liver and dead silk worms in brine.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Save Your Spouse, Roach Transfer, Couples Hang" - Four couples compete a member of each couple tries to free the mate from a box submerged in water contestants must remove roaches from a candy box using only their mouths.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Ferris Wheel, Fear Factor Pizza, Water Platform" - After a "blizzard" hits, contestants must balance on a spinning Ferris wheel while dining on pizza topped with bile and blood.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Bobbing in Blood, Tomato Hornworm, Skunk Crawl" - Contestants must bob for objects submerged in 50 gallons of cow blood players must eat tomato hornworms and then gather skunk carcasses from inside a darkened tunnel.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Vertical Two Square, Eel Tank, Heli Rodeo" - Female contestants must transfer electric eels from one container to another players must straddle a bull-like object as it swings from a helicopter over a lake.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: With walkers inside the gates of Alexandria, Rick and the group are scared, outnumbered, and things are only getting worse.

programme.title: Talking Dead on "No Way Out"
programme.desc: Greg Nicotero, Carrie Underwood & a surprise cast member discuss The Walking Dead episode, "No Way Out." Host Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: Pilot
programme.desc: A highly dysfunctional blended family is forced together when they realize a reported virus is actually the onset of the undead apocalypse.

programme.title: So Close, Yet So Far
programme.desc: While Madison struggles to keep Nick from crippling withdrawal, Travis ventures out to find his son before the city of Los Angeles falls.

programme.title: England: A Walking Dead Reunion
programme.desc: Norman Reedus and Jeffrey Dean Morgan take in the sights and sounds of London then roam mystic landscapes to meet an old friend and a rock icon.

programme.title: Inside The Walking Dead Season 6: Volume 2
programme.desc: Get an inside look from the cast and creators of the sixth season of The Walking Dead. Season 6, Episodes 5 to 10.

programme.title: Friday Night In with The Morgans: Episode 10
programme.desc: The Morgans check in with their friends Garret Dillahunt, Michelle Hurd, and Sonia Barnes-Moorhead via video chat.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: With walkers inside the gates of Alexandria, Rick and the group are scared, outnumbered, and things are only getting worse.

programme.title: Talking Dead on "No Way Out"
programme.desc: Greg Nicotero, Carrie Underwood & a surprise cast member discuss The Walking Dead episode, "No Way Out." Host Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: Pilot
programme.desc: A highly dysfunctional blended family is forced together when they realize a reported virus is actually the onset of the undead apocalypse.

programme.title: Hercules Reborn
programme.desc: When a young man's bride is kidnapped by an evil king, he turns to Hercules for help. The fallen hero has been living in exile, banished for killing his family, but the young man's courage inspires Hercules. Together, they fight to rescue the bride and reclaim Hercules' honor.

programme.title: Mega Shark vs Giant Octopus
programme.desc: Strange things are afoot in the depths of the sea. First a passenger plane vanishes over the Pacific Ocean. Then an oil platform is obliterated. Marine biologist Emma MacNeil (Deborah Gibson) is dispatched to investigate the phenomena, and, with the help of Japanese scientist Seiji Shimada (Vic Chao), she makes a discovery that will rock the world: An enormous prehistoric shark and a giant octopus have been awakened from their icy slumbers -- and they're hungry.

programme.title: Merlin and the War of the Dragons
programme.desc: Before growing into the legendary adviser to the Pendragons, a youthful Merlin spends his days studying with the Mage (Jürgen Prochnow), a master sorcerer, and honing his magical skills. When a fellow apprentice sorcerer, Hengest (Iago McGuire), grows jealous of Merlin's rapid progress, he rebels against their mutual mentor and betrays King Vortigen (Hefin Wyn) to Saxon invaders. As Hengest conjures an army of dragons, Merlin prepares to test his developing abilities in battle.

programme.title: Hansel and Gretel
programme.desc: In this modern retelling of the classic horror tale, teen siblings are enslaved by a psychotic recluse within her gruesome house of horrors in the woods.

programme.title: Lord of the Elves
programme.desc: In an ancient age, the peace-loving Hobbits are enslaved by the Java Men, a race of flesh-eating dragon-riders. The young Hobbit Goben must join forces with their neighbor giants, the humans, to free his people and vanquish their enemies.

programme.title: Sinbad And The War Of The Furies
programme.desc: On a treasure hunt gone wrong, modern-day adventurer Sinbad accidentally releases the Furies, three beautiful but terrible ancient beings powerful enough to threaten life on Earth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a little girl got sick and died, investigators were stumped. Was it an accident, an unexplained illness or murder?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression took her own life. But her sister told police that she said if anything were to happen to her there would be a note in the china cabinet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An aspiring model turned up dead and the prime suspect was her boyfriend. When he was eventually cleared, investigators had to dig deeper to find the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an off-duty policeman was shot dead, his fellow officers were determined to solve the crime. They needed clues to find the killer and they discovered them in tiny fibres and an asthma inhaler.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: One warm summer afternoon, the town of Verona, Wisconsin faced its first triple homicide. To solve the case, investigators had to delve into the world of high rollers and offshore betting.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The medical examiner ruled the death an accident, but the detectives investigating the case thought the evidence at the scene indicated otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run boating accident caused the death of a popular young man, investigators faced the daunting task of searching for one boat among 1200 others.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young man was killed in a mysterious car crash, but the evidence at the scene led investigators to believe it was not an accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman went missing, friends and family were determined to find her. Their worst fears were confirmed weeks later when her body was discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, 82-year-old Kathryn Bishop was found dead in her Pennsylvania home. Tiny clues on the victim's body would tell police what happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A bomb, constructed to cause as much damage as possible, kills a victim with deadly force and flame. When a search yields some tiny clues, police are able to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A twelve-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the number and volume of bloodstains at the scene was greater than usual, it was up to forensic scientists to find out why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a respected police officer was murdered in her own home. The crime went unsolved for more than a decade, until a newly formed cold case unit took a fresh look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: They thought the fire would cover their crime. But one tiny clue, no bigger than a thumbtack, remained. It held all the information investigators needed to put a trio of killers behind bars.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Shannon Melendi disappeared while at Emory University. Her disappearance remained a mystery for ten years, until new scientific testing cast a different light on Colvin "Butch" Hinton.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "Designing for the Duchess" - The designers meet British royalty in London, England as inspiration for winter wear. Debra Messing guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "Luck Be A Lady" - The stakes are high as the All Stars designers roll dice on the runway for a fashion gamble.

programme.desc: "Mix and Match.com" - Love is in the air as the All Stars design looks for Match.com singles on first dates. Orange Is The New Black's Laverne Cox guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "4 Seasons in One Finale" - The All Stars finalists design collections representing all 4 seasons of the year. Zac Posen and Mira Sorvino join the judges and a VIP audience to crown the winner. Season finale.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "What Makes an All Star?" - 13 All Stars return for the toughest season yet. Designers tap into their past to create a look inspired by a life moment that kick started their fashion career. Season premiere.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars

programme.desc: "Fashion 911" - In the notorious Unconventional Materials Challenge, designers turn NYC emergency services materials into runway worthy looks. Johnny Wujek guest judges.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Game Show
programme.desc: "Episode 202" - 10 contestants don day-glo lycra and pit themselves against the most absurdly difficult challenges on television. The aim of the game to beat 5 games without losing all of their 50 lives. How will tonight's contestants including Drama Teacher Dan, Business Man Abdul and Vocal Performer Misha fare against games such as Hop and Hide, and Enter Trouser? Commentary team The Rubberbandits provide their unique take on all the action.

programme.title: Kelly Oubre Channels His Rockstar Energy while Chris Paul's Fit Flops | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown" discusses players like PJ Tucker experimenting with patterns and new brands, Kelly Oubre's latest rockstar fit, overalls having a comeback thanks to players like Russell Westbrook, and the problem with wearing too many graphics at once. Our host Matt Barnes even takes a look at some fits from his playing days.

programme.title: Joe La Puma Breaks Down How To Pair Sneakers with Your Fits | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Joe La Puma joins the panel this week for the season two finale to discuss how to find the perfect pair of sneakers to pair with your outfit. The hosts also crown their best dressed players of the season so far, and discuss the personal styles of NBA superstars like LeBron James and Giannis Antetokounmpo. Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also give their picks for the worst tunnel outfits of the year thus far.

programme.title: Marcus Jordan Says New Air Jordan Project Is On The Way | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Son of NBA legend Michael Jordan, Marcus, stops by this week on 'Tunnel Takedown.' He teases an upcoming Air Jordan project with his store Trophy Room coming in 2020, and gives his thoughts on the latest fits from stars like Kemba Walker and PJ Tucker. Host Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also discuss Carmelo Anthony's style to celebrate his recent return to the NBA and roast some more of the league's most flagrant fits.

programme.title: Racks Loses It Over Russell Westbrook and JaVale McGee Needs a Shirt | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week, Racks Hogan, Mouse Jones and Kalysse Anthony break down their favorite looks of the week and get into a heated discussion over Russell Westbrook. Plus, renowned stylist Derek Roche previews the upcoming style trend while on the set of French Montana's new video. Then, Kalysse walks us through the do's and don'ts of Dopp kits and the hosts go in on JaVale McGee's bold fit.

programme.title: TMarkGotKickss Vs WhoisHeck In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we are putting two acquaintances against one another. In one corner we have the Chief Operating Officer of PrivateLabelNYC, Hector Aponte, taking on the outfit grid king, Terrel Marcus aka TMarkGotKickss! Both battlers displayed a wide variety of hyped and exclusive sneakers you won't see often! Check out the episode and let us know who won this battle?!

programme.title: Kyle Kuzma Shows Up in Supreme and PJ Tucker Keeps It Comfy | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week, hosts Racks Hogan, Kalysse Anthony and Mouse Jones get into it over PJ Tucker's satin Dolce & Gabbana outfit, and break down Kevin Durant and Kyle Kuzma's pre-game fits. Then, celebrity stylist Derek Roche shows us how to put looks together for a tall, athletic basketball player. Plus, the hosts go head-to-head in a game of Guess Who, and celebrate the legacies of Dwyane Wade and Dirk Nowitzki.

programme.title: Detroit Pistons Langston Galloway vs Nike SB Collector in a Sneaker Battle From Home!
programme.desc: On this episode we have NBA player and sneaker collector, Langston Galloway, from the Detroit Pistons going up against Complex's "Best Kept Secret" Kevin Luyster in an epic Sneaker Battle From Home! Both came equipped with a variety of sneakers in an all out 5 round battle! You won't get any spoilers here, watch the episode and decide for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Qias Omar vs HesKicks In A Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we pit two "Shoetubers" against one another. They both started their respective channels back in 2012, Heskicks vs Qias Omar, is a battle of old school collecting versus new school hype! The two put on a display of versatility for the public in an incredible 5 round battle! Make sure you watch and debate for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Lavar Ball vs Jacques Slade In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we managed to put on the most unexpected pairing to date! In one corner, he is an OG to the Sneaker Youtube space, some would consider him the Godfather of sneaker unboxing videos, @Jacques Slade aka Kustoo is here to battle! His opponent is the undefeated one, this man NEVER LOST a single competition of any sort in his life, Lavar Ball is here to battle! Watch the battle and let us know who won this matchup!

programme.title: Watch King Combs Choose Between Drake & Pusha T for Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: Complex Brackets is a new game show from Complex News where your favorite celebs choose the best rapper in any one of these four categories: Best East Coast Rapper, Best West Coast Rapper, Best Rapper of the Decade, and Best Rapper of All Time. In this episode, King Combs hits a wall when he has to choose between Drake and Pusha T for the crown of Best Rapper of the Decade. Be sure to check out Complex Brackets every Monday at 2:00pm EST right here on Complex News.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Crowns The Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: The Dirty South dominates throughout this episode when Moneybagg Yo sticks to his roots as he goes through our Best Rapper of the Decade bracket. The Memphis rapper delivered upset after upset while being faced with tough choices between hip hop giants and rappers who spoke to his life growing up. Make sure you share your choices in the comments below. Would you have picked the same?

programme.title: James Harden Rocks Louis Vuitton and Chris Paul Reps Black-Owned Brands | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On the latest "Tunnel Takedown," hosts Kalysse Anthony, Mouse Jones and Racks Hogan can't agree on Russell Westbrook's latest look and break down why James Harden's Louis Vuitton outfit missed the mark. Then, we shout out Chris Paul for his support of black designers, and Racks explains how to tell the difference between an original vintage t-shirt and a reproduction.

programme.title: Kiana Ledé Explains Her "Chocolate" Video
programme.desc: Check out the sixth episode featuring Kiana Ledé, as she reveals to us why she decided to do a FaceTime video for her track "Chocolate", her love for "Sex in the City" reruns and her competitiveness in Monopoly Deal. Also check out her latest album "KIKI," available now!

programme.title: The Perfect New York Slice with Frank Pinello and Michael Imperioli | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: In New York City, pizza isn't just food, it's a way of life. But which iconic NY-style dish reigns supreme: the Sicilian square or the classic round pie? In the series premiere of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Best Pizza's Frank Pinello to find out which slice is the true king of New York. And who better to judge the event than legendary actor and pizza obsessive Michael Imperioli?

programme.title: Binging with Babish Judges Movie-Inspired Pizzas: Nicole Russell vs Mike Greenfield | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Which movie-inspired pizza reigns supreme: the broccoli-topped pie from Inside Out, or "pizza in a cup" from The Jerk? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, Binging with Babish has challenged her and Pro Home Cooks' Mike Greenfield to take his silver-screen recreations to the next level. Will Nicole's Cup O' Pizza earn her a much-needed victory following a tough loss to Frank Pinello in Episode 1?

programme.title: The Ultimate Viral Pizza Showdown with Mike Hauke, Mark Iacono, and Scott Wiener | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Ramen, tacos, cheeseburgers, fried chicken-Mike Hauke of Tony Boloney's can turn just about anything into a pizza. But has the undisputed king of Instagramable pies finally met his match? In a brand new episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell attempts to wrestle the crown from Dr. Franken-slice in a viral pizza showdown for the ages. Will Nicole's popcorn-crusted bar pie be enough to topple Mike's bone-in "Flaming Cowboy"? Only pizza pros Mark Iacono and Scott Wiener can decide.

programme.title: Sean Evans and Farideh Sadeghin Taste Test Chicago Deep Dish Made by Two New Yorkers | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Can two thin-crust loving New Yorkers make deep dish pizza fit for a Chicago native? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza maker she must face off against Josephine Giordano of Lenny's Pizza to see if she can conquer the Windy City's most controversial culinary export. Will Nicole's chicken parm-packed deep dish be enough to the win the favor of Muchies' Farideh Sadeghin and Chicago native Sean Evans?

programme.title: The Perfect Detroit-Style Pizza with Cliff Skighwalker, Adam Richman, and Reina Scully | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Detroit is home to some of America's most delicious pizza. But who can create the ultimate Motor City-inspired slice? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, she must face off against chef Cliff Skighwalker in a good ol' fashioned pan-pizza throwdown.

programme.title: Mythical Chef Josh and Nicole Russell Make Taco Bell and Beef Patty Inspired Pizzas | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Pizza is the ultimate blank canvas for culinary innovation. In this episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Mythical Chef Josh to see who can create the ultimate "mashup pie." At Mythical Kitchen, Josh has perfected the art of fast-food fusion, but will his Doritos Locos Taco Pizza be enough to take down Nicole's Jamaican beef patty-inspired pie? The choice is up to this week's judges: Complex's Speedy Morman and chef Jae Lee of Nowon in NYC.

programme.title: Neapolitan-Style Pizza at Home with Vito Iacopelli, Nicole Russell, and Daym Drops | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: It's the season finale of Pizza Wars, and host Nicole Russell must now battle the final boss: master pizzaiolo Vito Iacopelli. Will Nicole's tandoori-inspired pizza be enough to impress food review legend Daym Drops, or will Vito's "connolo-style" slice steal the golden pizza trophy away from her for good? Only one oven can handle a pizza cage match of this magnitude: The Ooni Koda 16. Tune in to a very special episode of Pizza Wars to see who comes out on top.

programme.desc: NFL Hall of Famer Michael Strahan goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods for the Season 12 finale and talks about getting Air Jordans 1s in 1985, sitting front row at Kanye West's Yeezy Season fashion show, and his viral prank of getting his teeth fixed.

programme.title: Rod Wave Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Multi-platinum artist Rod Wave goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Kickzr4us in Tampa, Florida, and talks about his latest album, giving away Air Jordans, and his favorite Nike SB Dunks.

programme.title: Rowdy Rebel Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Rowdy Rebel joins Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his favorite Air Jordans, wearing Off-White x Air Jordan 1s when he went home, and wanting to go shopping with Bobby Shmurda in the future.

programme.title: G Herbo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: G Herbo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about how he used to clean sneakers growing up, camping out for shoes, and why he loves Air Force 1s so much.

programme.title: How to Cook a Double-Dipped Roast Beef Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: The double-dipped roast beef burger is an icon of Brooklyn, New York, and Burger Scholar George Motz is here to teach you how to make one at home. This regional one-off burger-known locally as the "Gargiulo"- hails from the historic roast-beef emporium Brennan & Carr. Here, the burger patty is topped with freshly sliced roast beef, sauteed onions, American cheese, and is eventually dunked in a vat of piping hot beef broth.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Steakhouse Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz usually smashes his patties with childlike glee. But today, he has his eyes set on a different prize: the luxurious, thick, dry-aged steakhouse burger! The beauty of this style is its lack of adornments-a juicy patty, cheese, and a sturdy bun, which all help emphasize the beef. In the words of Motz: "Take the upgrade people!" Without further ado, learn how to cook a perfect steakhouse burger at home!

programme.title: Between The Shades
programme.desc: A look into what labels a life in current LGBT America. Fifty conversations exploring the many different shades of being "gay" in America. This conversation focuses on the degrees and varying perceptions about how people define themselves, their lives, struggles and triumphs.

programme.title: Gay Mean Girls
programme.desc: S1 E1-2 | Lucy is a "very good ally" who stares at her best friend Miranda.... a lot. They hatch a plan to start Gay Prom Royalty together to promote equality at their school. Miranda pays Lucy a visit on a day off from school. We get a glimpse into Lucy's home life.

programme.title: My Trans Life
programme.desc: Being trans is a mental, physical and emotional journey and MY TRANS LIFE showcases inspiring trans individuals on their journeys of acceptance. From preparing for major surgery, to tackling love lives, to campaigning for equality, MY TRANS LIFE follows transgender people facing the world in the body they were meant to be in.

programme.title: My Lesbian Virgin Diaries
programme.desc: Three young people are at a turning point. Lily wants to explore a different side of her sexuality Lucia's keen to try a same-sex relationship, but isn't quite sure what the next steps are and Emily is realizing that her attraction to women is very real. Following the intimate journeys of three young women, this is a sex-positive celebration of young lives as they venture out into the lesbian world for the very first time.

programme.title: The Influencers
programme.desc: Six social media influencers compete for an exclusive brand deal with the latest millennial juice craze: Jücytox. As cameras capture each influencer IRL, the manicured versions they present to the world online begin to not just crumble, but implode before our eyes.

programme.title: Equality U
programme.desc: Equality U is a feature-length documentary following 34 young activists on the Soulforce Equality Ride. At some stops they're welcomed with open arms, at others they're arrested for trespassing or for simply attempting to open up a dialog. At every stop, they're connecting with young people who've often never met an openly gay, lesbian, bisexual or transgender person who is comfortable with who they are.

programme.title: The Library
programme.desc: As we seek to honor and celebrate the countless LGBTQ individuals, communities, sub-communities, and dynasties that have flourished in the face of adversity over decades, it dawned on us that there are so many unknown and untold stories about gay history, vocabulary, vernacular, and the human experiences that fuel the formation of cultures and identities based on authentic self-expression and love. As we discovered these stories, we wished for a gay "library" where anyone could visit and learn, in bite-size portions, about crucial events in gay history, gay heroes and icons past and present, fascinating sub-cultures, slang terms, scientific references, political movements... Essentially, a record of all the bits of queer education that are at risk of being lost or misinterpreted — information that we all crave as members of LGBTQ communities and as Allies. Do you know the story of the first Pride parade? Ever wondered what "Skoliosexual," "Polycule," or "Doppelbanger" means? The Library is open — and ready to clue you in.

programme.title: Backcountry Traditions S2:E2 "Alaska Part2"
programme.desc: Alaska is the crown jewel of fisheries. Its undisturbed ecosystem enables the Bristol Bay region to produce and sustain the world's largest sockeye population. The future of this delicate ecosystem is currently threatened by an existential and non-reversible threat. Knowledge is power. Learn how you can join the fight to save and preserve Bristol Bay.

programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E5

Then he runs out to the reef in search of more mutton snapper and takes a trip to Pig Island to feed and swim with the pigs. programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E6 "Peter and his girlfriend Alessia, travel to Pacific Fins, Guatemala targeting Big Mahi Mahi, Cubera Snapper and of course, sailfish."
programme.desc: Peter travels to Pacific Fins, Guatemala targeting Big Mahi Mahi, Cubera Snapper and of course, sailfish. Peter's girlfriend Alessia joins him on this adventure and is treated to her first ever, Giant Pacific Sailfish and massive Mahi Mahi. They cook the Mahi on the boat right after catching it and feast on it while sailfish keep interrupting them. They visit an avocado plantation and make some delicious guacamole, and then head into town and donate Salt Life clothing to the local kids and make new friends along the way.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E5 "Tracking Deer with Dogs, Does it work?"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we discuss one of the most interesting topics covered in a long time at Midwest Whitetail, tracking deer using dogs. Pro-staff member Mike Alberda introduces his brother Brian, who uses a tracking dog in the state of Michigan to blood trail deer. He covers how a dog tracks a deer, why someone would call him to use a dog in the first place, how someone can find a local tracker if it's legal in their state, and everything in between.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E6 "Jared’s Triple Beam Buck, Self-Filming Tips"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we first join Jared Mills who takes us all the way back to 2013 when he self-filmed harvesting one of his best bucks to date. Not only do we get to watch the great hunt again, Jared dives deep into how he was able to pull off such a high-quality self-filmed hunt. He goes through each phase and provides different tips along the way, that hopefully, will help you the next time you're out filming. Then we join Bill who has been out walking the farm finding sheds and unfortunately, two dead bucks he knows well.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E7 "Deadly Setup: The Open Gate"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we first join Bill as he takes down stands across the farm, inspecting them to make sure they're safe. One of the stands he made his way to was one of the deadliest stands on the entire farm, the "Open Gate." Bill goes into detail on why this stand works so well and relives two successful hunts. Then we join Josh Honeycutt in Kentucky, who gives us an update on how his off-season has been going and introduces his plans to catch up with his top targets this coming fall.

programme.title: Regional Classics
programme.desc: Some local dishes become so popular that they transcend their region. Gumbo is a taste of Louisiana in a big old bowl. And Cincinnati chili is American original, served with buttered spaghetti, kidney beans, cheddar cheese, and chopped onions. Our goal when developing our versions of these dishes was to remain faithful to the originals while making the recipes approachable for cooks who may not have grown up with them.

programme.title: Texas Rib House
programme.desc: Huge meaty flavor-combined with spice, smoke, and fire-epitomizes Texas barbecue. Could we figure out how to make authentic Texas beef ribs in our Boston-based test kitchen?

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: In this episode we look at a few of our favorite Tex-Mex dishes: tomato salsa, quesadillas, and beef tacos.

programme.title: Cooking with Squash
programme.desc: What could be more synonymous with fall than butternut squash, with its vivid orange color and sweet, earthy flavor? In this episode, we explore two main-course squash recipes: a creamy, comforting soup perfect for serving on a busy weeknight and a rich, hearty risotto suitable for entertaining.

programme.title: Meat and Potatoes for Company
programme.desc: Few main courses are as impressive as filet mignon, but such cachet comes with a hefty price tag. While the hallmark of this luxury cut is its buttery, tender texture, some argue that the beefy flavor is too mild, lacking the oomph of fattier cuts like rib eye. So we aim to boost the filet mignon's flavor with a lively peppercorn crust and a rich pan sauce.

programme.title: Fish and Chips at Home
programme.desc: The problem with English-style fish and chips is that you've got to hop a plane across the Atlantic to enjoy the most authentic version. We wanted to be able to serve English-style fish and chips-large pieces of moist and delicate cod in a crisp and tender coating with thick-cut fries-at home.

programme.title: Roast Beef and Potatoes
programme.desc: Test cook Natalie Estrada reveals the secrets to making a foolproof Classic Roast Beef Tenderloin with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, host Julia Collin Davison discovers equipment expert Adam Ried's top pick of tongs. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson shows Julia how to make perfect Lyonnaise Potatoes.

programme.title: Regional Italian-American Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison a New York classic, Prosciutto Bread. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of provolone cheese. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Bridget how to make the easiest-ever Drop Meatballs.

programme.title: Bourbon and Broccoli Hit the Grill
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison fires up the grill for host Bridget Lancaster, demonstrating the ultimate Grilled Bourbon Steak recipe. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of Dill Pickle Spears. Then, test cook Ashley Moore prepares an unforgettable Grilled Broccoli with Lemon and Parmesan. Finally, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews inexpensive options for Instant-Read Thermometers.

programme.title: Smoky Barbecue Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to tackle Texas-sized, Thick Cut Smoked Pork Chops. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his pick for dry measuring cups. Finally, Julia Collin Davison reveals the secret to achieving the perfect Backyard Barbecue Beans.

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster make a Lone Star State classic-Flank Steak in Adobo. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for inexpensive blenders. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Julia how to make the ultimate Texas Breakfast Tacos.

programme.title: Spaghetti House Classics
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Julia Collin Davison the perfect Hearty Beef Lasagna. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of block mozzarella. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Bridget a new weeknight favorite-Chicken Scarpariello.

programme.title: Korean Feast
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make dolsot bibimbap. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews spider skimmers in the equipment corner. Finally, test cook Dan Souza prepares Korean-style fried chicken wings.

programme.title: Comfort Classics
programme.desc: Julia makes the Best Roast Chicken With Root Vegetables and Dan Souza makes Almost No-Knead Sourdough Bread.

programme.title: Tamales and Tacos
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison prepare tamales with a red chile-chicken filling. Finally, test cook Dan Souza makes Julia chorizo and potato tacos.

programme.title: Elegant Desserts
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to the most decadent bar cookie recipe-Millionaire's Shortbread. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for serrated knives. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Bridget the ultimate Gateau Breton with Apricot Filling.

programme.title: Pork Patties and Steak on the Grill
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget and Julia prepare bun cha on the grill. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for kitchen shears. Finally, Dan and Julia make negimaki.

programme.title: Chicken and Biscuits
programme.desc: Test cook Becky Hays and host Julia Collin Davison make the perfect Indoor Pulled Chicken with Sweet and Tangy Barbecue Sauce. Tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of basmati rice, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews the gadgets you didn't know you needed, and test cook Erin McMurrer unlocks the secrets to making Ultimate Flaky Buttermilk Biscuits at home.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Washington’s Character, Charisma & Ambition
programme.desc: Founding father George Washington helped shape the great nation known as the United States of America. Chef Walter Staib’s favorite segments featuring George Washington are compiled for this very special episode of A Taste of History.”

programme.title: Graham Kerrs Kitchen - Picadillo and Georgetown Flakey
programme.desc: Quick family fare: the classic Mexican dish of black beans and peppers and simple chili with T.V.P.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Seoul Food Chronicles
programme.desc: The best of South Korea’s capital city, The Seoul Food Chronicles cover everything from royal court cuisine to late-night drinks and snacks consumed exclusively in pop-up tents. An energetic episode chock full of exciting footage, Marja and Jean-Georges also share their finds for historic temples and palaces, striking fashion, and even take a spin in an amusement park.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Waianae Aquaculture
programme.desc: Hawaii Cooks travels to Oahu’s rural beachside community of Waianae to find out how local families are raising sunfish fish in their backyards for sustenance and economic independence. Roy uses the Waianae raised sunfish to create a macadamia nut and parsley flavored crispy sunfish.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Hominy and Chili Casserole & Stewed Corn/Green Onion
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Hominy and Chili Casserole & Stewed Corn/Green Onion!

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Poached Chicken
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking poached chicken, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Red Dunn Kitchen Louisiana Creole Gumbo Parc
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Tarick Salmaci, Roger Wessel and Taylor Sherman who review casual, urban food, including Green Eggs and Ham, at Red Dunn Kitchen red beans and rice, Shrimp Po Boy’s, and Mississippi Mud Cake at Louisiana Creole Gumbo and classy casual fare at the upscale Parc restaurant.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Counting Sheep
programme.desc: Rising‐star chefs and husband-wife duo Duskie Estes & John Stewart show us why Sonoma’s sheep are prized for their milk, which becomes award‐winning cheese, including that made by master cheese makers Bellwether Farms. In their home kitchen, they prepare a variety of dishes with ingredients from their own backyard garden and the fresh cheeses from Bellwether Farms.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Dark Green Vegetables
programme.desc: Chef Staib prepares Codfish filets with Wilted Spinach, Grilled Vegetable Napolean, and Broccoli Feta Salad.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Frank Lee, Gary Danko, and Alan Sayers
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Sauteed Shiitake Mushrooms with Foie Gras, Steamed Moroccan-style Salmon Steak, and Chilled Summer Fruit Soup with Sesame Ice Cream. Restaurants include: Slightly North of Broad in Charleston, The Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco, and Goodfellows in Minneapolis.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - Last Flight Out Of Shanghai
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Chef Keiko Takahashi, the first Japanese woman in the world to win a Michelin star. She and her husband run Keiko on Nob Hill, a place that feels like a private club, and where the luxurious cooking has a distinct feminine style to it.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - Family Matters
programme.desc: Chef Stellino recalls the charming quirks of his family in Italy and America. Dishes Include: Pasta All' Arrabbiata (Pasta with a spicy tomato sauce) / Salsicce Brasate con Broccoli e Peperoni (Braised sausages with broccoli and peppers) / Banana Cream Pudding.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Fantastic Farro / Farro Fantastico
programme.desc: Savory, not sweet is Mary Ann’s Farro Cake. Fiber-packed, whole-grain cooked farro mixed with parsley, sage and thyme makes for an herb-infused treat. This versatile grain makes a perfect base for Mary Ann’s familiar favorite, Farro Salad filled with sweet red peppers, diced fennel, tangy capers, and sliced mushrooms.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Happy Tea
programme.desc: Martin, with the help of a few experts, explores the subtleties of Chinese tea, in New York, Yokohama and Singapore. He then takes us on a tour of bake shops in Chinatowns around the world. This episode's recipes include: Pineapple Buns, Sweet Bride’s Delight Cakes, Jade Scallop Dumplings, and Nori-Sesame Shrimp Toasts.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Europe's Grill
programme.desc: When it comes to European grilling, Italy and Greece grab the headlines. Here's a look of some of Europe's lesser-known grilling traditions.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Winter Favorites
programme.desc: When the temperature drops, foods should deepen in flavor. These are the dishes we make when it's cold outside. A Chicken Bolognaise that's lower in fat than the traditional version, Fennel Roasted Vegetables, and a cheesecake made with flavorful mascarpone.

programme.title: Lidias Italian Table - Risotto
programme.desc: In Italy, a great risotto always brings a smile. Here, we all smile as Lidia prepares Risotto Milanese, a simple risotto with saffron broth, finished with butter and Parmigiano Reggiano, and Suppli di Telefono, risotto rolled into balls filled with prosciutto and mozzarella, then crisply fried. When split, the mozzarella pulls apart like telephone wires, thus the name.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Big Smoke
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in his first big Mexican city Guadalajara, where he will sample a classic slow cooked goat dish known as Birria, before heading to the iconic town of Tequila and going behind the scenes at a boutique distillery.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - The Real Mexico
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita gets to know the real Mexico, traveling to the ghost town of Real de Catorce in search of peyote, before heading south to the romantic town of Guanajuato to learn how to make the most ubiquitous of all Mexican food, tortillas.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Megacity
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in one of the largest metropolises on earth, Mexico City, discovering a city of extremes with high end dining sitting side by side with some of the cheapest and tastiest street food in the world.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - That’s a molé!
programme.desc: Contrary to popular opinion, molé is not just a chilli chocolate sauce, although molé poblano is the most well-known and this episode sees Peter Kuruvita learn the secrets to this incredibly complicated concoction.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Melting Pot
programme.desc: Episode 7 sees Peter Kuruvita arrive in the coastal state of Veracruz where he discovers the technique of smoking jalapenos into chipotles, before visiting the original home of vanilla.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Culinary Capital
programme.desc: Oaxaca is the undisputed culinary capital of Mexico, and Peter Kuruvita spends a week here sampling all this city has to offer, from cheese to tamales and even a serving of grasshoppers.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Chili and Chocolate
programme.desc: Peter Kuruvita arrives in the Mayan stronghold of the Yucatan Peninsula, major producer of one of the hottest chilies on earth - the Habanero, before heading to the state of Tabasco where chocolate has been consumed for thousands of years.

programme.title: Mexican Fiesta with Peter Kuruvita - Mexico’s Last Frontier
programme.desc: In the final episode of Mexican Fiesta, we travel to the cloudy forests of Chiapas near the border with Guatemala where Peter explores a state with the highest indigenous population in Mexico and with it, some of the most interesting food yet.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Hokkaido
programme.desc: Henry makes a comeback through this brand new journey to conquer the Land of the Rising Sun. He kicks off his great adventure in Hokkaido, the second largest and least developed of Japan's four main islands with a Japanese local. They also explore the popular zoological garden, Asahiyama Zoo, learns of rare moss balls, and goes canoeing at the Shiretoko Lake. From indulging in the beauty of the Biei Hills, to facing staggering cold temperatures at the Ice Pavilion, to experiencing wetlands ecosystems at the Kushiro-shitsugen National Park, he spends his first days in Japan with the unspoiled nature of Hokkaido.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Tohoku
programme.desc: Henry lands in the Tohoku region where he visits the historical Chusonji Temple and it's Konjikido, which literally means Golden Hall, one of the most magnificent twelfth century structures that is still well-preserved. He travels from Morioka to Sendai and learns about the art of making kokeshi dolls at the Kokeshi Doll Museum. Since Tohoku is well-known for its countrysides, mountains, and lakes, he travels to Tashiro Island and Iimoro Mountain for their picturesque scenery. As an avid foodie, he also experiences a traditional way of eating soba noodles by using green onions in place of chopsticks at a local village. He finally ends his experience in Tohoku with a stay at Ouichi Inn.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Kanto
programme.desc: Arriving in Kanto via night train, Henry winds down at the Kusatsu Hot Springs, where he experiences a unique Yumomi dance performed that is used to adjust the water temperatures naturally without using cold water. The next day, he continues his exploration in the town of Minakami through an adrenaline-pumping session of water rafting, bungee jumping and camping. Later, he travels back in time in Edo Period at the Edo Wonderland Nikko, exploring the streets of the village in their traditional clothing. Also watch Henry transform into a colorful Japanese cosplay character at the Jupiter Cosplay Shop. Before traveling to Central Tokyo, he gains new insights to railways in Japan at the Railway Museum. He finally enjoys some alone time at a Solitary Karaoke session and Purikura Shop that have been popular among young people here.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Tokyo
programme.desc: As Henry continues his journey in Tokyo, he starts his morning early at the Tsukiji Fish Market where he learns how to cut Meguro and prepare sushi with a Japanese local. They also experience eating and training with sumo wrestlers at a local Sumo training centre. After an exhausting training session, they explore some of the best of Tokyo which includes the Tokyo Skytree, baseball game at the Tokyo Dome, and batting cage. They also visit Shinjuku's famed Robot Restaurant that features exploring Japanese rock sounds, crazy dancing girls, and Japanese drum performance, accompanied by intense lighting. Henry's Tokyo experience closes at the Studio Ghibli animation film studio as well as shopping at Akibahara.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Chubu
programme.desc: Upon arrival in Chubu, Henry kicks off his exploration by hiking up Mount Fuji with a Japanese local. Later, they explore a theme park near the mountain base, called Fuji-Q Highland, that is known for its fun rides and attractions. After cycling around Hida City and having fun at the Takayama Festival, they head over to Shirakawa-go, the historical village, to experience its unique architecture and attractions. Later, Henry hears of a world of ice that never melts even in the middle of summer and insists on visiting the Narusawa Hyoketsu caves. Finally, their adventure in Chubu tones down at the spring waters of Oshino Hakkai is made out of underground water from Mount Fuji.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Kansai
programme.desc: Henry travels to Osaka to experience standing on Japan's tallest building, Abeno Harukasu. He visits Kamigata Ukiyoe Museum right after, the only art museum in the world that exhibits ukiyoe paintings where he also learns how to create ukiyoe paintings. Exploring a different side of himself, Henry learns about being a geisha in the city. He enters the grounds of Nijo Castle and Kyoto's most popular geisha district in Gion to experience the culture and lifestyle back in the Edo Period. The child in him lights up as he transform into a ninja at the Iga Ryu Ninja Museum dedicated to the history of ninja and ninjutsu. To end his trip in Kansai, he gets a taste of a monk's lifestyle through an overnight stay at the temple lodging in Mount Koya.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Chugoku
programme.desc: As one of the most well-known historical moments, a Japanese local introduces to Henry the development of Hiroshima since the war at the Atomic Bomb Dome and pays a visit to one of Japan's most exalted shrines, Itsukushima Shrine. They also explore the hidden pearls of Hiroshima Bay through oyster boat shucking. As their stomach begin to growl, they go ahead to devour the humongous okonomiyaki micky that includes six noodle servings and two cabbages. Riding on the humongous theme, they also check out a giant calligraphy piece produced on an 8m long paper using a large brush with a 30cm long and 15cm wide head. After shopping at Mizuki Shigeru Road and exploring Tottori Beach, they decide to go sea kayaking. They finally end their stay by chartering a boat offshore to watch the ocean-bound aurora where visitors bask in the captivating vision of bluish white waves.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Shikoku
programme.desc: Henry's adventure in Shikoku begins at Botchan Train. He attempts cormorant fishing during the day and visits the Dogo onsen at night to relax and unwind. The next day, he experiences the Awa-odori folk dance which is usually performed to welcome the souls of ancestors in the Bon season. Then he samples a local Tosa Tataki Dojo and travels out on boat for some spectacular whale watching.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Kyushu
programme.desc: In Kyushu, Henry visits the Kumamoto Castle which offers one of the most complete castle experiences in Japan with a Japanese local. They also discover the history behind one of Japan's most famous swordsman and ronin, Miyamoto Mushashi. Later, Henry learns more about Yanagawa punting and the antique Japanese Arita porcelain. At the Nagasaki Penguin Aquarium, they experience penguins not just by making eye contact, but by actually interacting with the wonderful creatures. They also attempt a traditional dry beach fishing method from the Edo Period by catching the unique gobble-eyed Gobi. Wrapping up their journey in Kyushu, they experience garden light illumination at a European resort themed on Holland, Haus Ten Bosch.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Ceiling Fan, Bonsai
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner replace an undersized ceiling fan with a more appropriate one. Kevin, Tom, Richard and Roger ask ""What Is It?"" Later, Roger visits a bonsai nursery to learn the art of sculpting trees.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Lightning, Sink Filter
programme.desc: Kevin and Roger meet with Meteorologist Jim Cantore to discuss Jim's biggest weather fear‰Û_ÌãÌ¨lightning. Roger heads to Orlando to see a lightning protection system installed. Richard helps a homeowner install a reverse osmosis filter for drinking water. And the guys ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Lighting, Water Main
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron heads to Cleveland to install some landscape lighting. Kevin, Tom, Richard and Roger ask ""What Is It?"" Then Richard replaces a water main shutoff.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Mailbox, Reuse Door
programme.desc: Roger helps a homeowner replace a mailbox that was damaged by a snowplow. Kevin shares some information about window anatomy. Tom helps a homeowner reuse an old door in a new opening. And the guys ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Noisy Heat, New Lights
programme.desc: Tom and Kevin discuss kitchen island dimensions. Richard helps a homeowner quiet a noisy baseboard heating system. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Later Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner add light to a kitchen by install three new recessed cans.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Houseplants, US Flag
programme.desc: Roger heads to Maine to help a homeowner plant an indoor tropical garden with plants from Jamaica. Richard, Roger, Kevin and Tom ask ""What Is It?"" Richard shows how to change the temperature on water heaters. Then Tom and Kevin built an American flag out of reclaimed wood.

programme.title: Ask TOH | EV Charger, New Sink
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner install an electric vehicle charger next to his house. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Then, Richard helps a homeowner install a new kitchen sink and faucet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Thermostat, Solar
programme.desc: Roger teaches Kevin about lengths to consider when mowing the lawn. Richard travels to Pittsburgh to install a thermostat that interfaces with a smartphone to save energy and money. Ross Trethewey walks Kevin through the installation of a photovoltaic solar array on the barn. And Kevin, along with Tom, Richard and Roger ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | 35 Years of This Old House
programme.desc: In celebration of 35 years of This Old House, we look back at all that's changed in the last 35 years, and also what hasn't: our commitment to delivering trusted ideas and information to empower homeowners. This season begins in Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown. Kevin and Norm highlight Charlestown's historical importance, from colonial times through WWII. Our new project is part of a cluster of 1850s-era Greek Revival houses tucked into the backside of Bunker Hill. Homeowner Angela Daigle shows Kevin the period feel and features of her home that she loves, but also the outdated kitchen and poor organization of space that she'd like to improve. Upstairs, Tom Silva shows Norm the spaces that will be getting minimal work: an existing guest room, guest bath, and living room. But one level up, on the third floor, it will likely be a full gut to give Angela a better master suite with additional living space, assuming the City approves the plan to enlarge the existing dormers. Out back, Roger shows Kevin the sad state of the crumbling retaining walls. Then Kevin finds Richard formulating a plan for the basement. Norm stops in next door to meet Maggie Boone to see how she recently addressed a lot of the same issues that Angela faces by renovating her own row house. And Norm and Tom test for lead paint before beginning demo on the first floor, as downstairs, Kevin, Richard and mason Mark McCullough start digging into the project.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Bridge to Charlestown
programme.desc: Richard gets up close and personal with one of Charlestown's most iconic structures-the Zakim Bridge-by talking with the structural engineer on the project, Ted Zoli. At the project house, Kevin finds the front of the building obscured by scaffolding it will be used to replace the failing asphalt roof, and also to build the dormer, if approval comes in from the City. Inside, Tom shows Kevin how he'll have to modify the old chimney for the new gas fireplace units, and they see the framing progress, including the new bump out for the breakfast area. The third floor master suite is all framed up, save the dormer, which is still in regulatory limbo. In the backyard, mason Mark McCullough presents options for rebuilding the decaying retaining walls at different price points. Then, they dig into the demolition, carrying all of the old wall material out through the house, by hand. Norm visits a salvage yard in Boston's South End that has dozens of architectural elements from the Greek Revival period, including a marble mantel and some glass doorknobs that are perfect for Angela's house. Several days later, Mark starts installing the homeowner's choice for the retaining wall: an interlocking concrete system with a bluestone cap. Richard shows Kevin the progress on the rough plumbing and electrical, including a high velocity mini duct system that will pair with an electric inverter heat pump unit to supply either air handlers or high wall cassette units. It's an efficient and quiet solution, which is perfect for this close-knit City location.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Wood and Water
programme.desc: Richard stops by the Charlestown Navy Yard to see a very special guest arrive: the last wooden whaling ship in the world, the Charles W. Morgan, which was built c.1840, just a decade before our project house. At the jobsite, Norm finds architect Sally DeGan, who shares the good news that after months of work and waiting, our new dormer was finally approved. Up at the roofline, Tom shows Norm the progress on the dormer, and how he's carefully waterproofing its low slope roof. Inside, Kevin notes progress: insulation went in a few days ago and wallboard is going up. Out back, to tie in the new work with the old house, mason Mark McCullough installs a reclaimed brick veneer on the new kitchen bump out. Kevin drops in to see kitchen designer Kathy Marshall at her studio in Wenham, Massachusetts, where she is working on the interior design details with homeowner Angela Daigle. For a more authentic look, Norm and Tom replace the fake, applied vinyl shutters on our house with authentic, operable shutters make out of durable fiberglass and PVC.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.

programme.desc: The Chicago team creates a gravity-defying cake depicting the ingredients to a great marriage Christopher Garrens makes a cake based on the movie "Edward Scissorhands" the NYC bakery builds a chandelier-inspired cake, complete with lighting system.

programme.title: Amazing Wedding Cakes: Tiffany, Modern Cutouts and Pink Orchids Wedding Cakes
programme.desc: The Tiffany-inspired cake is black and white with blue accents, and creates tension in the OC bakery as Chris pushes for perfection. The CakeGirls tackle a modern cake with cutouts and the NY bakery adds stenciling to a white cake with orchids.

programme.title: Amazing Wedding Cakes: Pirate Ship Cake Diner Desserts Bridal Shower Cake Magnolia Cake
programme.desc: The LA team crafts a sea-worthy Pirate Ship cake, while Christopher Garren's bakery draws inspiration from a diner for a bridal shower cake. And Ben at the Chicago bakery challenges his artistic side working on a Magnolia-inspired wedding cake.

programme.title: Amazing Wedding Cakes: Wheel of Cheese Groom's Cake, A Picnic Wedding Cake, Calla Lilies Cake
programme.desc: The Chicago girls whip up a picnic cake with a roasted-pig topper the LA bakery makes a cheesecake that looks like (what else) a wheel of cheese and Christopher Garren's Cakes creates an elegant cake with inverted tiers and yellow calla lilies.

programme.title: The Locator: A Mother's Peace of Mind
programme.desc: As a child, Cindy was placed by her mother into a two-parent home. At 18, she put her own son up for adoption. Now, twenty-two years later, she enlists Troy's help to find out if she made the right decision.

programme.title: F.L.I.P. Mysteries: Women on the Case: Pilot
programme.desc: FLIP is a team of women who band together online to track clues and solve cases across the country.

programme.title: The Locator: A Brother's Story
programme.desc: Jerry and his sister have been searching for their half brother for almost 40 years. The two reached out to Troy because they and their ailing mother are desperate to reconnect with Michael after all this time.

programme.title: The Locator: Katie's Last Hope
programme.desc: Adopted as a baby, Katie has always wanted to meet her birth family. Troy gives Katie the surprise of her life when he finds her birth mother. Will this meeting help Katie get the answers she's been seeking?

programme.title: The Locator: Stolen Kisses
programme.desc: Angel was separated from her twin sons after her ex-husband moved away with the boys. Angel reached out to Troy, who located the twins. Will they be interested in reuniting with their biological mother?

programme.title: The Locator: Brother's Lost & Found
programme.desc: Ricardo grew up an only child but has an older brother who was given up for adoption. Now, Ricardo wants Troy to help him find his brother after years of unsuccessful searches.

programme.title: The Locator: A Wife's Gift
programme.desc: John's wife wants to surprise him on their wedding anniversary with a reunion with his younger sisters, who were separated from him over thirty years ago.

programme.title: The Locator: A Daughter's Tears
programme.desc: Jaclyn's father disowned her after she had a baby out of wedlock at 21. Jaclyn would like the chance to tell her father that she is getting her life together. Will Troy be able to locate him?

programme.title: The Locator: 25 Years Later
programme.desc: Annie and Nicole were partners in crime in high school, but were separated after a stint in juvenile detention. Annie is sober now and wants to reunite with Nicole to show her the kind of woman she's become.

programme.title: The Locator: A Mother's Last Wish
programme.desc: Carolyn lost custody of her young daughter in a bitter divorce. Remarried and undergoing chemotherapy for a hereditary disease, she wants to see her daughter again to alert her about the disease.

programme.title: The Locator: A Mother's Hope
programme.desc: Sandra found out she has a sister, Jennie, after reading about it in her mother's diary. Now, her mother has terminal cancer. Will Jennie be interested in reuniting with her biological mother and sister?

programme.title: The Locator: A God Daughter's Dream
programme.desc: Samantha is seeking her godmother after being separated when Samantha was only 14. Hattie now has 2 sons of her own and describes Samantha as "the daughter I never had." Will Troy be able to reunite them?

programme.title: The Locator: A Daughter's Dream & The Last Sister
programme.desc: Wendy tries to re-unite her estranged family, twenty years after their mother abandoned them. Nycole, who has reunited with three of her four siblings, remains desperate to find their youngest sister.

programme.title: The Locator: The Dad Who Didn't Know...
programme.desc: Twenty-five year old Chad has just returned from his second tour in Iraq, and is determined to meet his father, who has no idea that Chad was ever born.

programme.title: The Locator: A Daughter's Mission
programme.desc: Alexia's mother is not willing to share information about her biological father, so Alexia has enlisted Troy's help to track him down - behind her mother's back.

programme.title: The Locator: A Son's Search
programme.desc: Chris' mother committed suicide when he was only 3 years old. Now, years later, he and his wife enlist Troy's help in finding his biological father.

programme.title: The Locator: A Daughter's Promise
programme.desc: One week before his second birthday, Warren's father picked him up for a visit and never returned. Now, 28 years later, Warren's sister, Holly, is determined to reunite him with their mother, Carol. Will Troy succeed in reuniting this family?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 5 Chefs Compete" - Each chef can only spend ten dollars on ingredients for their next meal. A jury of gourmands taste the dishes and estimate how much they would pay for them.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 4 Chefs Compete (Part One)" - The four chefs must teach bachelors with no cooking experience how to prepare monkfish. The winner and a chosen guest get to ride on a Goodyear blimp.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 4 Chefs Compete (Part Two)" - The last four chefs taste dishes at the Savoy Grill, then must recreate one. The winner spends time with their family on a yach while the losers clean the dormitories.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 2 Chefs Compete" - In the season finale, the final two chefs travel to the London West Hollywood to be judged by five of Gordon Ramsay's top chefs.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day One" - Twelve chefs and restaurateurs compete to impress Gordon Ramsay as he works to open a world-class restaurant in Los Angeles and discover the country's next culinary star.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Two" - After barely surviving the opening night of the Hell's Kitchen restaurant, the contestants prepare for their second dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Three" - The budding chefs prepare for their third dinner service, but the pressure of Hell's Kitchen is too much for one contestant.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Four" - Tensions arise in the kitchen during all-Italian night at the restaurant, with one team playing dirty to get ahead.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Five" - The players attempt to re-create Gordon's signature dishes for a discerning crowd at a Los Angeles eatery.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Six" - In the first half of this two-hour special, Chef Ramsay reveals the latest twist: each team will create its own menu consisting of three appetizers, entrees and desserts.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Seven " - In the final part of this two-hour special, the five remaining contestants learn that they're no longer competing as teams, but as individuals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: PJ's Steakhouse
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse, a restaurant that is dying due to management's lack of control and poor food quality.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Peter's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Peter's, a family-run Italian restaurant in Babylon, New York. He discovers that the eatery is sinking because of its brash manager and co-owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Dillon's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in the Big Apple to revamp Dillon's, an Indian restaurant just blocks away from his own thriving eatery. Stubborn owner Mohammed loses approximately $25,000-$50,000 a month.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Mixing Bowl
programme.desc: Located in Bellmore, New York, The Mixing Bowl faces an influx of competition and barely has customers. Chef Ramsay strives to correct problems with the restaurant's appearance and menu.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Seascape
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay must work with a hard-headed chef and inexperienced owners to make some changes and bring customers back to Seascape.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Olde Stone Mill
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to The Olde Stone Mill in Tuckahoe, New York. Although the front has been renovated, the kitchen still serves less-than-stellar food.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sebastian's
programme.desc: Sebastian's prepares frozen food from a complex menu and the wait staff is more concerned about auditioning for their acting roles than serving meals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fine McCool's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits the family-run Finn McCool's in Westhampton, New York and faces an obnoxious head chef who happens to be the owner's son.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Lela's
programme.desc: Lela's is an upscale restaurant in desperate need of clientele. When Chef Ramsay starts criticizing the menu, the executive chef sees red, leading to a showdown in front of the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Campania's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay heads to Fair Lawn, New Jersey to find a lackadaisical wait staff hurting the Italian restaurant Campania's.
